events.message: I have just been involved in a car accident. My vehicle was hit on the rear side at a stoplight, causing significant damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the nature of the collision involving the policyholder's vehicle.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the case and will contact the claimant within 24 hours to discuss next steps.
The claimant has been informed that their claim is officially acknowledged and is now in process for further review.
We requested the claimant submit photographs of the vehicle damage, police report, and insurance information from other involved parties.
The claimant has provided all requested documents, including photos and police report, which will assist in proper assessment.
Our claims investigation team has begun reviewing all submitted evidence and statements to determine liability and extent of damage.
After thorough assessment, the investigation has concluded with sufficient verification of the accident details and damages caused.
A settlement amount has been proposed based on assessed damages and applicable policy coverage for the claimant's vehicle repairs.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt communication and the fairness of the proposed settlement offer.
The claim has been officially approved by the insurance company, authorising repair work to begin on the vehicle.
Payment has been issued to the claimant's chosen repair shop as part of the settlement to cover the vehicle damage costs.
The claim is now closed following completion of vehicle repairs and final confirmation of all paperwork submitted.
All claim documents and correspondence have been archived for future reference and compliance with record-keeping policies.
